{"title":"Section 2, Page 37","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"37
of su"ar, and will be the means of uniting the whole parish
in support of the main road, and thereby secure the means,
promptly and certainly, that said parish should contribute to
its construction.
The resolution, on motion of Col. B. H. Payne,
was adopted.
Mr. Lawrence submitted a proposition for build-
ino- the road, and also leveeing the Mississippi on
the lower part of the river, where it is without embankment now, and declared his readiness to give
any security that may be required for the fulfillment of the contracts. His proposition and some
remarks with which he accompanied it were cheered.
No action was had on the matter, however.
A general cry here took place for Col. Payne, and
that gentleman came forward and briefly addressed
the convention. He expressed his high gratification
at. the prompt and business-like manner in which the
proceedings of this convention had been conducted.
They had shown that, as sensible men, they knew
how to take hold of a great enterprise. Their proceedings had resulted in bringing about a feeling of
kindness, of mutual sympathy and interests, which
would produce the happiest effect in furthering this
great enterprise. This road was boipd to be built—it
would be built. He had already spread before gentlemen in the country his views at length, and in was
quite unnecessary for him to say anything more than
to express his thanks for the kindness which had
been extended to him as an humble instrument in
the great enterprise. These few remarks of Col.
Payne were heartily cheered.","fullrs":{},"find":"2102.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2101","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"511084","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.49 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
